element.definition: The DecisionSupportServiceModule describes a unit of decision support functionality that is made available as a service, such as immunization modules or drug-drug interaction checking.
element.short: A description of decision support service functionality

element.comments: Can be a urn:uuid: or a urn:oid:, but real http: addresses are preferred.
element.definition: An absolute URL that is used to identify this decision support service module when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance. This SHALL be a URL, SHOULD be globally unique, and SHOULD be an address at which this decision support service module is (or will be) published. The URL SHOULD include the major version of the decision support service module. For more information see [Technical and Business Versions](resource.html#versions).
element.requirements: Allows the decision support service module to be referenced by a single globally unique identifier.
element.short: Logical uri to reference this decision support service module (globally unique)

element.comments: Typically, this is used for identifiers that can go in an HL7 v3 II data type - e.g. to identify this decision support service module outside of FHIR, where the logical URL is not possible to use.
element.definition: A formal identifier that is used to identify this decision support service module when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance. e.g. CMS or NQF identifiers for a measure artifact. Note that at least one identifier is required for non-experimental active artifacts.
element.requirements: Allows externally provided and/or useable business identifiers to be easily associated with the module.
element.short: Additional identifier for the decision support service module

element.comments: There may be multiple different instances of a decision support service module that have the same identifier but different versions.
element.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the decision support service module when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the decision support service module author and is not expected to be globally unique. For example, it might be a timestamp (e.g. yyyymmdd) if a managed version is not available. There is also no expectation that versions are orderable. To provide a version consistent with the Decision Support Service specification, use the format Major.Minor.Revision (e.g. 1.0.0). For more information on versioning knowledge modules, refer to the Decision Support Service specification. Note that a version is required for non-experimental published artifacts.
element.short: Business version of the decision support service module

element.comments: The name is not expected to be globally unique. The name should be a simple alpha-numeric type name to ensure it is computable friendly.
element.definition: A natural language name identifying the decision support service module. This name should be usable as an identifier for the module by machine processing applications such as code generation.
element.requirements: Support human navigation & code generation.
element.short: Name for this decision support service module (Computer friendly)

element.definition: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the decision support service module.
element.short: Name for this decision support service module (Human friendly)

binding.description: The lifecycle status of a Value Set or Concept Map.

element.comments: Allows filtering of decision support service module that are appropriate for use vs. not.
element.definition: The status of this decision support service module. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.
element.short: draft | active | retired

element.comments: Allows filtering of decision support service module that are appropriate for use vs. not.
element.definition: A flag to indicate that this decision support service module is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
element.requirements: Enables experimental content to be developed following the same life-cycle as a production-level decision support service module would.
element.short: If for testing purposes, not real usage

element.comments: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the decision support service module. Additional specific dates may be added as extensions.
element.definition: The date  (and optionally time) when the decision support service module was published. The date must change when the business version changes, if it does, and it must change if the status code changes. In addition, it should change when the substantive content of the decision support service module changes.
element.short: Date this was last changed

element.comments: This description can be used to capture details such as why the decision support service module was built, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is not a rendering of the module as conveyed in the text field of the resource itself. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.
element.definition: A free text natural language description of the decision support service module from the consumer's perspective.
element.short: Natural language description of the decision support service module

element.comments: This element does not describe the usage of the decision support service module (See, e.g, the comments element, or relatedArtifacts), rather it's for traceability of ''why'' the resource is either needed or ''why'' it is defined as it is.  This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this decision support service module.
element.definition: Explains why this decision support service module is needed and why it has been designed as it has.
element.short: Why this decision support service module is defined

element.definition: A detailed description of how the module is used from a clinical perspective.
element.short: Describes the clinical usage of the module

element.comments: The date may be more recent than the approval date because of minor changes / editorial corrections.
element.definition: The date on which the asset content was approved by the publisher. Approval happens once when the content is officially approved for usage.
element.short: When decision support service module approved by publisher

element.comments: If specified, this is usually after the approval date.
element.definition: The date on which the asset content was last reviewed. Review happens periodically after that, but doesn't change the original approval date.
element.short: Last review date for the decision support service module

element.comments: The effective period for a decision support service module  determines when the content is applicable for usage and is independent of publication and review dates. For example, a measure intended to be used for the year 2016 would be published in 2015.
element.definition: The period during which the decision support service module content was or is planned to be effective.
element.short: The effective date range for the decision support service module

element.comments: When multiple usageContexts are specified, this means that all the contexts are applicable to this context. For example, if a gender and age group is specified, a patient must match the specified gender and age group for the asset to be considered applicable.
element.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These terms may be used to assist with indexing and searching of code system definitions.
element.requirements: Assist in searching for appropriate content.
element.short: Content intends to support these contexts

binding.description: Countries and regions within which this artifact is targeted for use

element.definition: A jurisdiction in which the decision support service module is intended to be used.
element.short: Intended jurisdiction for decision support service module (if applicable)

element.definition: Clinical topics related to the content of the module.
element.requirements: Repositories must be able to determine how to categorize the module so that it can be found by topical searches.
element.short: Descriptional topics for the module

element.definition: A contributor to the content of the module, including authors, editors, reviewers, and endorsers.
element.requirements: Consumers of the content must be able to quickly determine who contributed to the content of the knowledge module.
element.short: A content contributor

element.comments: Usually an organization, but may be an individual. The publisher (or steward) of the decision support service module is the organization or individual primarily responsible for the maintenance and upkeep of the decision support service module. This is not necessarily the same individual or organization that developed and initially authored the content. The publisher is the primary point of contact for questions or issues with the decision support service module. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.
element.definition: The name of the individual or organization that published the decision support service module.
element.requirements: Helps establish the "authority/credibility" of the decision support service module.  May also allow for contact.
element.short: Name of the publisher (Organization or individual)

element.comments: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number, etc.
element.definition: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
element.short: Contact details for the publisher

element.definition: A copyright statement relating to the decision support service module and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the decision support service module.
element.requirements: Consumers of the library must be able to determine any legal restrictions on the use of the decision support service module and/or its content.
element.short: Use and/or publishing restrictions

element.comments: Each related resource is either an attachment, or a reference to another resource, but not both.
element.definition: Related resources such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.
element.requirements: Modules must be able to provide enough information for consumers of the content (and/or interventions or results produced by the content) to be able to determine and understand the justification for and evidence in support of the content.
element.short: Related resources for the module

element.definition: The trigger element defines when the rule should be invoked. This information is used by consumers of the rule to determine how to integrate the rule into a specific workflow.
element.short: "when" the module should be invoked

element.definition: The parameters to the module. This collection specifies both the input and output parameters. Input parameters are provided by the caller as part of the $evaluate operation. Output parameters are included in the GuidanceResponse.
element.short: Parameters to the module

element.definition: Data requirements are a machine processable description of the data required by the module in order to perform a successful evaluation.
element.short: Data requirements for the module

name: DecisionSupportServiceModule
publisher: Health Level Seven International (Clinical Decision Support)

constraint.human: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain any narrative
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource

element.definition: The DecisionSupportServiceModule describes a unit of decision support functionality that is made available as a service, such as immunization modules or drug-drug interaction checking.
element.short: A description of decision support service functionality

element.comments: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.
element.definition: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.
element.short: Logical id of this artifact

element.definition: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content may not always be associated with version changes to the resource.
element.short: Metadata about the resource

element.comments: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element as much as possible.
element.definition: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.
element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created

element.comments: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource  Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).
element.definition: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.short: Language of the resource content

element.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied).  This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded in formation is added later.
element.definition: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

element.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.
element.definition: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.short: Contained, inline Resources

element.comments: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.
element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions.

DecisionSupportServiceModule DomainResourceA description of decision support service functionality
url Î£0..1uriLogical uri to reference this decision support service module (globally unique)
identifier Î£0..*IdentifierAdditional identifier for the decision support service module
version Î£0..1stringBusiness version of the decision support service module
name Î£0..1stringName for this decision support service module (Computer friendly)
title Î£0..1stringName for this decision support service module (Human friendly)
status ?!Î£1..1codedraft | active | retired
PublicationStatus (Required)
experimental ?!Î£0..1booleanIf for testing purposes, not real usage
date Î£0..1dateTimeDate this was last changed
description 0..1markdownNatural language description of the decision support service module
purpose 0..1markdownWhy this decision support service module is defined
usage 0..1stringDescribes the clinical usage of the module
approvalDate 0..1dateWhen decision support service module approved by publisher
lastReviewDate 0..1dateLast review date for the decision support service module
effectivePeriod Î£0..1PeriodThe effective date range for the decision support service module
useContext Î£0..*UsageContextContent intends to support these contexts
jurisdiction Î£0..*CodeableConceptIntended jurisdiction for decision support service module (if applicable)
Jurisdiction ValueSet (Extensible)
topic 0..*CodeableConceptDescriptional topics for the module
contributor 0..*ContributorA content contributor
publisher Î£0..1stringName of the publisher (Organization or individual)
contact Î£0..*ContactDetailContact details for the publisher

parameter 0..*ParameterDefinitionParameters to the module
